channel.title: CVE Feed for Palo Alto Networks -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Palo Alto Networks -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-9471|2024-10-09T20:33:15.742Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the XML API of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an authenticated PAN-OS administrator with restricted privileges to use a compromised XML API key to perform actions as a higher privileged PAN-OS administrator. For example, an administrator with "Virtual system administrator (read-only)" access could use an XML API key of a "Virtual system administrator" to perform write operations on the virtual system configuration even though they should be limited to read-only operations.

item.title: CVE-2024-9470|2024-10-09T17:06:13.944Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xsoar
item.description: A vulnerability in Cortex XSOAR allows the disclosure of incident data to users who do not have the privilege to view the data.

item.title: CVE-2024-9473|2024-10-09T17:38:11.807Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- globalprotect%20app
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app on Windows allows a locally authenticated non-administrative Windows user to escalate their privileges to NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM through the use of the repair functionality offered by the .msi file used to install GlobalProtect.

item.title: CVE-2024-9465|2024-10-09T17:04:01.720Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description: An SQL injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Expedition allows an unauthenticated attacker to reveal Expedition database contents, such as password hashes, usernames, device configurations, and device API keys. With this, attackers can also create and read arbitrary files on the Expedition system.

item.title: CVE-2024-9471|2024-10-09T17:06:41.456Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the XML API of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an authenticated PAN-OS administrator with restricted privileges to use a compromised XML API key to perform actions as a higher privileged PAN-OS administrator. For example, an administrator with "Virtual system administrator (read-only)" access could use an XML API key of a "Virtual system administrator" to perform write operations on the virtual system configuration even though they should be limited to read-only operations.

item.title: CVE-2024-9464|2024-10-09T17:03:33.904Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description: An OS command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Expedition allows an authenticated attacker to run arbitrary OS commands as root in Expedition, resulting in disclosure of usernames, cleartext passwords, device configurations, and device API keys of PAN-OS firewalls.

item.title: CVE-2024-9469|2024-10-09T17:05:55.091Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A problem with a detection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a user with Windows non-administrative privileges to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

item.title: CVE-2024-9466|2024-10-09T17:04:36.252Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description: A cleartext storage of sensitive information vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Expedition allows an authenticated attacker to reveal firewall usernames, passwords, and API keys generated using those credentials.

item.title: CVE-2024-9463|2024-10-09T17:03:12.012Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description: An OS command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Expedition allows an unauthenticated attacker to run arbitrary OS commands as root in Expedition, resulting in disclosure of usernames, cleartext passwords, device configurations, and device API keys of PAN-OS firewalls.

item.title: CVE-2024-9467|2024-10-09T17:04:56.867Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description: A reflected XSS vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Expedition enables execution of malicious JavaScript in the context of an authenticated Expedition user's browser if that user clicks on a malicious link, allowing phishing attacks that could lead to Expedition browser session theft.

item.title: CVE-2024-9468|2024-10-09T17:05:29.055Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: A memory corruption vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows an unauthenticated attacker to crash PAN-OS due to a crafted packet through the data plane, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition. Repeated attempts to trigger this condition will result in PAN-OS entering maintenance mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-8689|2024-09-11T18:24:17.891Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- activemq%20content%20pack
item.description: A problem with the ActiveMQ integration for both Cortex XSOAR and Cortex XSIAM can result in the cleartext exposure of the configured ActiveMQ credentials in log bundles.

item.title: CVE-2024-8686|2024-09-11T18:48:53.965Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: A command injection vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an authenticated administrator to bypass system restrictions and run arbitrary commands as root on the firewall.

item.title: CVE-2024-8690|2024-09-11T18:24:05.107Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A problem with a detection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a user with Windows administrator privileges to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

item.title: CVE-2024-8691|2024-09-11T18:19:46.897Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: A vulnerability in the GlobalProtect portal in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables a malicious authenticated GlobalProtect user to impersonate another GlobalProtect user. Active GlobalProtect users impersonated by an attacker who is exploiting this vulnerability are disconnected from GlobalProtect. Upon exploitation, PAN-OS logs indicate that the impersonated user authenticated to GlobalProtect, which hides the identity of the attacker.

item.title: CVE-2024-8688|2024-09-11T18:24:45.419Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: An improper neutralization of matching symbols vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS command line interface (CLI) enables authenticated administrators (including read-only administrators) with access to the CLI to to read arbitrary files on the firewall.

item.title: CVE-2024-8687|2024-09-11T18:25:14.604Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: An information exposure vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software that enables a GlobalProtect end user to learn both the configured GlobalProtect uninstall password and the configured disable or disconnect passcode. After the password or passcode is known, end users can uninstall, disable, or disconnect GlobalProtect even if the GlobalProtect app configuration would not normally permit them to do so.

item.title: CVE-2024-5915|2024-08-20T13:20:36.459Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- globalprotect%20app
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5916|2024-08-14T18:25:01.965Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: An information exposure vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables a local system administrator to unintentionally disclose secrets, passwords, and tokens of external systems. A read-only administrator who has access to the config log, can read secrets, passwords, and tokens to external systems.

item.title: CVE-2024-5914|2024-08-14T18:17:47.424Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xsoar%20commonscripts
item.description: A command injection issue in Palo Alto Networks Cortex XSOAR CommonScripts Pack allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands within the context of an integration container.

item.title: CVE-2024-5915|2024-08-14T18:02:09.956Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- globalprotect%20app
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5908|2024-08-09T19:08:25.260Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- globalprotect%20app
item.description: A problem with the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app can result in exposure of encrypted user credentials, used for connecting to GlobalProtect, in application logs. Normally, these application logs are only viewable by local users and are included when generating logs for troubleshooting purposes. This means that these encrypted credentials are exposed to recipients of the application logs.

item.title: CVE-2024-5910|2024-07-12T03:55:26.351Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description:
Missing authentication for a critical function in Palo Alto Networks Expedition can lead to an Expedition admin account takeover for attackers with network access to Expedition.
Note: Expedition is a tool aiding in configuration migration, tuning, and enrichment. Configuration secrets, credentials, and other data imported into Expedition is at risk due to this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-5912|2024-07-11T14:37:33.165Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: An improper file signature check in Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent may allow an attacker to bypass the Cortex XDR agent's executable blocking capabilities and run untrusted executables on the device. This issue can be leveraged to execute untrusted software without being detected or blocked.

item.title: CVE-2024-5911|2024-07-10T18:40:02.209Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Panorama software enables an authenticated read-write administrator with access to the web interface to disrupt system processes and crash the Panorama. Repeated attacks eventually cause the Panorama to enter maintenance mode, which requires manual intervention to bring the Panorama back online.

item.title: CVE-2024-5912|2024-07-10T18:40:16.240Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: An improper file signature check in Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent may allow an attacker to bypass the Cortex XDR agent's executable blocking capabilities and run untrusted executables on the device. This issue can be leveraged to execute untrusted software without being detected or blocked.

item.title: CVE-2024-5913|2024-07-10T18:40:29.769Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- pan-os
item.description: An improper input validation vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an attacker with the ability to tamper with the physical file system to elevate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-5910|2024-07-10T18:39:26.006Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- expedition
item.description:
Missing authentication for a critical function in Palo Alto Networks Expedition can lead to an Expedition admin account takeover for attackers with network access to Expedition.
Note: Expedition is a tool aiding in configuration migration, tuning, and enrichment. Configuration secrets, credentials, and other data imported into Expedition is at risk due to this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-5909|2024-06-12T19:52:05.711Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low privileged local Windows user to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

item.title: CVE-2024-5905|2024-06-12T17:58:51.232Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a local low privileged Windows user to disrupt some functionality of the agent. However, they are not able to disrupt Cortex XDR agent protection mechanisms using this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-5907|2024-06-12T16:26:39.742Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges. However, execution does require the local user to successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

item.title: CVE-2024-5909|2024-06-12T16:29:23.822Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low privileged local Windows user to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

item.title: CVE-2024-5908|2024-06-12T16:28:08.131Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- globalprotect%20app
item.description: A problem with the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app can result in exposure of encrypted user credentials, used for connecting to GlobalProtect, in application logs. Normally, these application logs are only viewable by local users and are included when generating logs for troubleshooting purposes. This means that these encrypted credentials are exposed to recipients of the application logs.

item.title: CVE-2024-5905|2024-06-12T16:22:57.869Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a local low privileged Windows user to disrupt some functionality of the agent. However, they are not able to disrupt Cortex XDR agent protection mechanisms using this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-5906|2024-06-12T16:22:38.881Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- prisma%20cloud%20compute
item.description: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Prisma Cloud Compute software enables a malicious administrator with add/edit permissions for identity providers to store a JavaScript payload using the web interface on Prisma Cloud Compute. This enables a malicious administrator to perform actions in the context of another user's browser when accessed by that other user.

item.title: CVE-2024-5907|2024-06-12T17:59:59.312Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges. However, execution does require the local user to successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

item.title: CVE-2024-5906|2024-06-12T18:17:47.920Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- prisma%20cloud%20compute
item.description: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Prisma Cloud Compute software enables a malicious administrator with add/edit permissions for identity providers to store a JavaScript payload using the web interface on Prisma Cloud Compute. This enables a malicious administrator to perform actions in the context of another user's browser when accessed by that other user.

item.title: CVE-2024-5907|2024-06-14T03:56:05.821Z -- palo%20alto%20networks -- cortex%20xdr%20agent
item.description: A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges. However, execution does require the local user to successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

item.description: An improper input validation vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an attacker with the ability to tamper with the physical file system to elevate privileges.
